text: The <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> wild type ( <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + ) and <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> knockout ( <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - ) mice were purchased from The Jackson Laboratory ( Bar Harbor , Maine 04609 USA ) .
The mice were housed and bred under specific pathogen free conditions at the Laboratory Animal Research Center of Chungbuk National University , Korea .

The mice ( n = 4 / cage ) were maintained in a room with a constant temperature of 22+ / - 1degreesC , relative humidity of 55+ / -10 % , and 12-h light / dark cycle , and fed standard rodent chow ( Samyang , Korea ) and purified tap water ad libitum .

The <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice ( n = 20 ) and <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice ( n = 20 ) , that were used , had matched ages ( 10-11 weeks old ) and weights ( 16-19 g ) .
Control mice ( B6129PF2 / J ) were F2 hybrid mice from the C57BL / 6J-AW-J and 129P3 / J parental strains .

<extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mice ( B6 , 129P2-Ccr5tm1Kuz / J ) have the entire coding region of the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene deleted from the parental strains , B6 ; 129P2-Ccr5tm1kuz and B6 ; 129P2-Cmkbr5tm1Kuz .
